title: How to Search and Find About Someone Using Image Easily

steps.title: Find the image that you want to search with.
steps.content: Find the image that you want to search with. You can use Google to search by image instead of text. Google will attempt to find other copies of the same image on the internet, as well as provide visually similar images. This can help you determine where the picture originated from, and potentially find more pictures of the same person. You can search from images that have been saved to your computer, or you can search using the image's URL. [1] X Research source To find an image's address, right-click on it and select "Copy image address/URL." To save an image to your computer, right-click on it and select "Save image." If you're using a mobile device, click here instead .

steps.title: Visit the Google Images website.
steps.content: Visit the Google Images website. Visit images.google.com in your browser. You'll see the familiar Google search field. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Camera button on the right side of the search field.
steps.content: Click the Camera button on the right side of the search field. This will allow you to search by image . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Add your image that you want to search with.
steps.content: Add your image that you want to search with. There are two ways to search by image: [4] X Research source Select "Paste image URL" and paste the copied address into the field. Select "Upload an image" and browse for the image that you saved to your computer.

steps.title: Click "Search by image."
steps.content: Click "Search by image." A list of search results will be displayed. If the image was found in other sizes, these will be displayed at the top. Pages where the same image can be found will be displayed beneath, and visually similar images can be found at the bottom of the first page of results. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Install the Chrome browser
steps.content: Install the Chrome browser for your device. You can't use the Google Image Search website to search by image on a mobile device, but you can use the Chrome mobile browser to search instead. You can get Chrome for free from your device's app store if you don't have it already. This method works for both iOS and Android. You can also use TinEye (above) by copying and pasting the URL for the image that you want to search with. Press and hold an image and select "Copy image address" to copy the URL to your device's clipboard. You can then paste this into the TinEye search field. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Find the picture you want to search with.
steps.content: Find the picture you want to search with. You can't upload an image, but you can search using any picture you come across online. Use Chrome to navigate to the image that you want to search with. [7] X Research source If you only have an image file on your computer, upload it to an image host like Imgur first and then navigate to it on your mobile device.

steps.title: Press and hold on the image that you want to search with.
steps.content: Press and hold on the image that you want to search with. A menu will appear after a moment. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Select "Search Google for this image."
steps.content: Select "Search Google for this image." This will perform a Google Image search based off the image you pressed.

steps.title: Browse through the results.
steps.content: Browse through the results. Google will provide its best guess for what the image name is, as well as provide links to pages that its used on. Visually similar images can be found at the bottom of the first page of results.

steps.title: Find the image that you want to search with.
steps.content: Find the image that you want to search with. TinEye is a search engine designed to search through images. You can search using either an image's URL or by uploading an image file. While TinEye does not find similar images, you can use it to quickly trace the origin of an image. [9] X Research source To find an image's address, right-click on it and select "Copy image address/URL." To save an image to your computer, right-click on it and select "Save image."

steps.title: Visit the TinEye website.
steps.content: Visit the TinEye website. Go to tineye.com in your web browser. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Upload your image or paste your copied URL.
steps.content: Upload your image or paste your copied URL. Click the Upload button to browse your computer for an image file, or paste the copied image URL into the field. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Browse through the search results.
steps.content: Browse through the search results. TinyEye will only return results for the same image, so browse through the results to find the origin of the image file.

steps.title: Visit pages with the image to potentially find more information.
steps.content: Visit pages with the image to potentially find more information. The page that contains the image may be able to give you more information as to the person's identity. Check out a couple of the results to see if you can learn more about the person in the image. Look for image captions or the paragraph text around the image.
